instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 5v - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 1.4v
threads.message:
I have this board that doesn't look to have any liquid damage and is stuck at 5v and 0.21amps on all 4 ports. There isn't any boot loop just a steady 5v. I was getting 1.4v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and so far I have replaced <CHIP>U6903</CHIP>, <RESISTOR>R6910</RESISTOR>-13, <CAPACITOR>C6910</CAPACITOR>/11/13/15/16 and <DIODE>D6902</DIODE> . 

I still get the same voltage but I noticed when I remove <RESISTOR>R6915</RESISTOR> from the board I get 3.39v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> but I still get 5v on the charger but 0amps this time. When I put <RESISTOR>R6915</RESISTOR> back on it goes to the original issue. 

I visually inspected all the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips and there doesn't look to be any damage to any of them or around them.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 5v - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 1.4v
threads.message: Check diode mode to ground on the 4 LDOs of each <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 5v - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 1.4v
threads.message:
In diode mode to ground here are all the 3v3 LDO measurements.
CB308 - 0.487v
CB408 - 0.486v
<CAPACITOR>C3108</CAPACITOR> - 0.484v
<CAPACITOR>C3208</CAPACITOR> - 0.487v
1v8 LDO
CB305 - .048v
CB306 - .051v
<CAPACITOR>C3205</CAPACITOR> - 0.478v
<CAPACITOR>C3206</CAPACITOR> - 0.514v
<CAPACITOR>C3105</CAPACITOR> - 0.475v
<CAPACITOR>C3106</CAPACITOR> - 0.51v
CB405 - 0.481
CB406 - 0.515
1v1 LDO
CB304 - .498v
CB404 - .504v
<CAPACITOR>C3104</CAPACITOR> - .498v
<CAPACITOR>C3204</CAPACITOR> - .503v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 5v - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 1.4v
threads.message:
The values look good.
You should have a problem with other chip connected to <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Post diode mode to ground at <CAPACITOR>C6920</CAPACITOR>.
Injecting 3.5V there may help to find something with a good IR camera.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 5v - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 1.4v
threads.message:
Okay I injected voltage and found that CB300 was getting really hot. I replaced that and now it turns on the trackpad clicks, I hear the apple sound that happens when you plug your charger in and the caps lock button turns green when pressed. The only thing is nothing appears on the screen.

Where do you first check for screen issues?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 5v - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 1.4v
threads.message: Check external monitor and USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 5v - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 1.4v
threads.message: I get a light on my usb stick I plug in but there is no image or anything from an external tv plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 5v - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 1.4v
threads.message:
Need to see flashing Link LED for boot pendrive.
Only then you have USB activity confirmed.

Caps Lock key reacts every time?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 5v - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 1.4v
threads.message: Yes I have a flashing link LED and yes the caps lock key reacts everytime.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 5v - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 1.4v
threads.message:
In this case, the board is active.

Looks like integrated Intel graphics is bad.
Compare diode mode readings on <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_X</SIGNAL> lines with good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 5v - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 1.4v
threads.message: I don't have another board to measure against but I plugged in another display assembly I know worked in the past and that didn't work. This time i also saw ESC light appear on the touchbar

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 5v - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 1.4v
threads.message:
You can compare diode mode readings between data lines of similar pair.
One data pair should have same value on its data lines.
